data.title: Current build gives unresolved __imp____iob_func  and __imp___vsnprintf
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: bleeding edge 2017_01_23
- devices test on:
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: 2015 community
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  download as zip from github
2.  run download-deps.py (fills in external folder)
3.  click on build/cocos2d-win32.sln (brings up VS 2015 community edition)
4.  right-click on Solution and choose 'build'
5.  I get: unresolved __imp____iob_func  and __imp___vsnprintf

data.title: Mac fullscreen works incorrectly when Retina display is scaled from Preferences
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.14.1
- devices test on: MAC
- developing environments
   MacOSx

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to system preferences->displays-> set resolution to scaled
2. Select more Space
https://www.dropbox.com/s/dg78y8lm6m85zkz/Screen%20Shot%202017-01-23%20at%203.04.50%20PM.png?dl=0

3. Run Mac build ***Fullscreen*** on xcode
4. Incorrect results (scaling is wrong)

data.title: using both restart and spine will cause memory leak and system crash
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:this bug occur on cocos2d js 3.11 to cocos2d js 3.14
- devices test on:iphone6sp and simulator 6se
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:8.2
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
unpack sdk 3.14
1. run js test project included in sdk packet
2. press Spine Test and then press Main Menu
3. press Sys Tests and find restartGame and press it
4. press Spine Test
5. memory will increase about 0.3M per second until system crash.

data.title: ccui.Editbox singleline setPlaceholderFontSize error
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.14.1 - lua
- devices test on:iPhone SE 10.1 (14B72)
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:8.1 (8B62)
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create ccui.EditBox
2. setInputMode with cc.EDITBOX_INPUT_MODE_SINGLELINE
3. setPlaceholderFontSize

-[CCUISingleLineTextField ccui_placeholderLabel]: unrecognized selector sent to instance 0x7f8fdd546640

Test Code:
```
local editBox = ccui.EditBox:create(cc.size(350, 70), "res/Image/common/edit_bg.png")
editBox:setInputMode(cc.EDITBOX_INPUT_MODE_SINGLELINE)
editBox:setPosition(cc.p(display.cx, display.cy))
editBox:setPlaceHolder("password")
editBox:setPlaceholderFontSize(32)
sceneWidget:addChild(editBox)
```

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Fix implicit conversion warning
data.body:
This PR suppresses a implicit conversion warning in Xcode 8.2.1 as shown below:

```
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp:1232:28: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_type' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
```

data.title: Fix typo in Sprite (strech -> stretch)
data.body:
This pull request fixes several spelling mistakes inside `Sprite` class, it does the following:

- Renames two variables
  - `_strechFactor` -> `_stretchFactor`
  - `_strechEnabled ` -> `_stretchEnabled`
- Replaces two functions with correctly spelled names
  - `setStrechEnabled` -> `setStretchEnabled`
  - `isStrechEnabled` -> `isStretchEnabled`
- Marks the misspelled functions as deprecated for backwards compatibility

Thank you for your time!

it seems we forgot to add header for Spine:

$(SRCROOT)/../cocos2d/cocos/editor-support

data.body:

   - Xcode version: 8.2.1

Steps to Reproduce:

experimental::AudioEngine::play2d("audio.mp3", false, 1.0);
Doesn't play any sound. Always returns -1;

PD: we have SimpleAudioEngine running a BackgroundMusic and other effects.
We want to change some effects to AudioEngine because in Android > 5 aren't reproducing.

Thanks.

data.title: Fix typos in local variables
data.body: This change set fixes several spelling errors in variable names. It also keeps backwards compatibility.

data.title: Fix typo in RenderTexture: "Bufffer" -> "Buffer"
data.body:
I found two spelling mistakes in the member variables inside`RenderTexture` class, so this patch changes the following:

- `_depthRenderBufffer` -> `_depthRenderBuffer`
- `_stencilRenderBufffer` -> `_stencilRenderBuffer`

data.title: A little bug about build_android.py in Cocos2d-x-3.14
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on:
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. enter the project directory and run `cocos compile -p android --android-studio -m release`
2. it will produce some outputs like: `ioerror no such file or directory: jni/Application.mk`

I found this bug in `tools/cocos2d-console/plugins/plugin_compile/build_android.py`:

```Python
def _get_build_type(self, param_of_appabi):

        # get build type from parameter
        if param_of_appabi:
            return self._do_get_build_type(param_of_appabi)
        
        # get build type from Application.mk
        applicationmk_path = os.path.join(self.app_android_root, "jni/Application.mk")
        with open(applicationmk_path) as f:
            for line in f:
                if line.find('APP_ABI') == -1:
                    continue
                build_type = self._do_get_build_type(line)
                if build_type != self.LuaBuildType.UNKNOWN:
                    return build_type

        return self.LuaBuildType.UNKNOWN
```

the line `applicationmk_path = os.path.join(self.app_android_root, "jni/Application.mk")` should be replaced by

```Python
        if self.use_studio:
            applicationmk_path = os.path.join(self.app_android_root, "app/jni/Application.mk")
        else:
            applicationmk_path = os.path.join(self.app_android_root, "jni/Application.mk")
```

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
AudioEngine::play2d always returns a valid ID even if audio format is not supported
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14 (and previous releases)
- devices test on: N/A (although tested on Win32 and Android 7)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: N/A
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: 2015
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

When AudioEngine::play2d is called, it always returns a valid ID even if the audio file format is not supported on that platform (such as AAC/M4A format on Windows).   If the audio format is not supported, the audio player instance is removed, then the sound finishedCallback is never actually called.

If the game code gets a valid ID from play2d, then it expects the sound finished callback to be triggered, but if the sound was not actually played, then the game will be stuck waiting for an event that will never happen.

If AudioEngine::play2d instead returned AudioEngine::INVALID_AUDIO_ID if an unsupported audio format is used, then that would solve the problem completely.
